lead_paragraph: Adam Scott, the defending champion, took advantage of placid early conditions to shoot a course-record nine-under-par 63 to earn a share of the lead at the PGA’s Houston Open in Humble, Tex. Johnson Wagner matched Scott late in the day, and Charley Hoffman was two strokes behind the leaders. Scott, who has had a fever and swollen glands around his throat since arriving in Houston, went straight to the clubhouse for medical treatment after his round.
